reviews.review: Fajna Gra
Es un gran juego, algo complicado y lleno de terror

While I have played this game less than most others writing reviews, my point is still valid. I have played before Freddy rocked up. And those were fun, more balanced times. However, every single time I queue for a game I literally pray that I'm not against Freddy. Why you ask? The answer is simple. He is basically a killers dream. He is OP as hell and literally you just can't stop him. Other killers I can run away from but with Freddy he is just not only invisible with a very faint sing song which you can't always determine where he is, he is also very very fast.

It's not like I am writing a review to slate the game or to say do not buy it. It is a very good game, even more fun with a group of friends. I do however discourage anyone from buying the Freddy DLC because it is just daft. It is a good game otherwise so I have to give credit where credit is due.

honestly where do i begin. this game is just amazing yet can be tiresome at the same time. i mean what can i say about it, the grind to get everything is absolutely time consuming ( thats a good thing ) if you are looking for a game to grind whether it be 100% achievements or character progression to learning more and more things to get better and improve then this is the game for you. there is always a chance to grow and improve your game play/skill as the game its self is always changing whether it be through DLC, map changes, or even finding a new tile to loop the game offers so much potential. at the time of me writing this i have 2300 hours and im still learning and adapting to new things i find and experience during my game play. but thats not just it, like i said before this game has a huge grind for character progression. the time it takes to achieve all characters with prestige 3 and all perks is something to put time into. i have as i said 2300 hours and im only halfway to achieving 100% in character progression. so if your looking for a great game to get your hands on i suggest picking up dead by daylight, the game and its DLC is money well spent

Dead By Facecamp

Paid 20 euros for this game 1 and a half years ago, aproximately when it was released. At first you don't get anything of what's happening and you will either go out of your way and watch dozens of tutorials or you can learn everything by yourself, assuming you are dedicated to spend lots of hours in leveling up your characters, getting new perks which referesh the game's "repetitive" gameplay, prestiging your beloved prey...i mean survivors and your favourite killers.
       If you want the full experience, you will need to pay extra for the DLCs which, as of now, will cost you about 50 euros (with more to come in the future i am pretty sure). But these DLCs really make you want to jump straight back in the game if you were bored of it, as i was. After taking a 4-5 months break from DBD, i come back finding out that i missed 2 or 3 killer releases and some nice cosmetic items.I was forced to jump back in and give Dead by Daylight a second chance. That was an excellent decision.

       I hope you find this game as enjoyable as i find it 100, 500 even 1000 hours later. Dead by Daylight is a MUST have horror game- 8.5/10.
